titles.title: I-27 Numbering Act of 2023
I-27 Numbering Act of 2023
Airport and Airway Extension Act of 2024
Iâ€“27 Numbering Act of 2023
Iâ€“27 Numbering Act of 2023
Iâ€“27 Numbering Act of 2023
Iâ€“27 Numbering Act of 2023
I-27 Numbering Act of 2023

A bill to amend the Intermodal Surface Transportation Efficiency Act of 1991 to designate the Texas and New Mexico portions of the future Interstate-designated segments of the Port-to-Plains Corridor as Interstate Route 27, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.
Senate Committee on Environment and Public Works discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

reference.label: text of amendment in the nature of a substitute

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Kean (NJ) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 992.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Message on House action received in Senate and at desk: House amendment to Senate bill.

vote.text: Senate agreed to House amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary:
Iâ€“27 Numbering Act of 2023
This bill designates the future interstate highway system portions of the Ports-to-Plains Corridor within the states of Texas and New Mexico as Interstate Route Iâ€“27.
In Texas, from Sterling City to Lamesa, U.S. Route 87 is designated as Interstate Route Iâ€“27E and Texas Routes 158 and 349 via Iâ€“20 are designated as Interstate Route Iâ€“27W. The bill also excludes one portion of the Texas and New Mexico corridor; U.S. Route 287 from Dumas, Texas to the border between Texas and Oklahoma is designated as Interstate Route Iâ€“127N.
